key_statement.description: Branch leaf chlorophyllous cells in transverse section ± equilateral-triangular, often with conspicuous vertically oriented comb-fibrils on the hyaline cells where overlying chlorophyllous cells.
Branch cortical cells with funnel-like projections often extending halfway or more into the next cell; branches strongly clavate and blunt
Branch cortical cells with flat end walls or with weak funnel-like projections extending less than halfway into the next cell; branches not clavate or if clavate, with pointed ends.
Interior layer of stem cortical cells with distinct comb-lamellae; branch leaves with or without comb-lamellae; stem leaves without comb-lamellae
Interior layer of stem cortical cells without comb-lamellae or at least not visible with a light microscope; branch leaves with comb-lamellae; stem leaves with or without comb-lamellae.
Stem leaf hyaline cells with distinct comb-lamellae; branches clavate and pointed; branches leaves strongly imbricate
Stem leaf hyaline cells without distinct comb-lamellae; branches not clavate; branch leaves more or less spreading.

Stem leaves long (ca. 1.1–1.5 mm.); branch leaves narrow (breadth:length ca. 0.6–0.68), branch leaf comb-lamellae distinct throughout most of leaf; branch cortical cell comb-lamellae usually absent; plants dark brown
Branch leaf chlorophyllous cells in transverse section narrowly triangular, trapezoidal, truncate-elliptic, elliptic or lenticular; comb-fibrils if present horizontally oriented.
Branch leaf chlorophyllous cells in transverse section short-elliptic, elliptic to lenticular, and enclosed on both surfaces.
Branch leaf chlorophyllous cells in transverse section short-elliptic and well enclosed; plants purplish red when pigmented
Branch leaf chlorophyllous cells in transverse section narrowly elliptic and slightly enclosed on both surfaces; plants brown when pigmented.

Branch leaf chlorphyllous cells in transverse section without thickened ends walls; superficial stem cortical cells with reinforcing fibrils weak or absent; branch leaf hyaline cells where overlying chlorophyll cells often with comb- fibrils

Branch leaf chlorphyllous cells in transverse section with thickened end walls; superficial stem cortical cells with strong reinforcing fibrils; branch leaf hyaline cells where overlying chlorophyllous cells smooth
Branch leaf chlorophyllous cells in transverse section narrowly triangular, rectangular to truncate-elliptic, exposed equally on both surfaces or more broadly on the convex surface.
Branch leaf hyaline cells papillose where overlying chlorophyllous cells
Branch leaf hyaline cells epapillose where overlying chlorophyllous cells.
Superficial stem cortical cells with fibrils weak or lacking; chlorophyllous cells rectangular to truncate-elliptic, exposed equally on both surfaces
Superficial stem cortical cells with strong fibrils; chlorophyllous cells triangular, exposed more broadly on concave surface.
Branch leaf hyaline cells where overlying chlorophyllous cells often with irregular worm-like ridges, especially at the leaf base; pores on the convex surface numerous, small and round to elliptic
Branch leaf hyaline cells smooth throughout; pores on the convex surface elliptic to flattened-elliptic, not numerous
